result.execSummary:
The defendant Kevin M Coffen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Financial obligations in 21CM1919 and 22CM380 to be paid as a condition of probation at the rate of $150 per month.  Commencing 8/12/22

AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment recommended.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia.  Maintain absolute sobriety. All prescriptions to be filled at the same pharmacy.  Inform Agent of all prescriptions.

Follow any conditions deemed appropriate by Agent.  No contact with Victim B listed in case 21CM1919.

Maintain/obtain full time employment (35 hours per week)  Domestic violence counseling to be determined by Agent.

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: To be completed in the first 10 months of probation, as a condition of probation, as directed by Agent.

records.addlTxt: Affidavit of Services for Court appointed counsel and billing statement, received and filed, by Jeremy J Guza
Conclusion of Court Appointment Letter
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

11:38 AM Defendant Kevin M Coffen in court with attorney Jeremy J Guza.  Melissa J. Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case called for jury status hearing in 21CM1919.  
Parties have reached an agreement.
Court conducts plea colloquy.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Count 2 is dismissed and read in.
Statement by Victim A.  Recommendations by the State.  Recommendations by the Defense.  Statement by defendant.

The Court Orders the Following:

Count 1:
Imposed and Stayed Sentence of:
90 Days Jail CONSECUTIVE to 21CM1919

Term of Probation: 12 Months
Conditions of Probation:
-	Follow any conditions deemed appropriate by Agent;
-	No contact with Victim B in 21CM1919
-	AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
-	Absolute Sobriety; 
-	No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia;
-	All prescriptions to be filled at the same pharmacy
-	Inform agent of all prescriptions;
-	Maintain/Obtain full time employment (35 hours per week);
-	Domestic violence counseling to be determined by Agent.  
-	Completed 20 hourt Community Service within the first 10 months of probation.

COSTS:  $ 243.00

DV Surcharge: $ 100.00

DNA Surcharge: $ 200.00

DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 

Total costs/fine/forfeiture:  Financial obligations in 21CM1919 and 22CM380 to be paid as a condition of probation at the rate of $ 150.00  per month commencing 8/12/22. Failure to pay;  will result in a civil judgment.

Hearing on July 26, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Hearing on August 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.

10:48 AM Defendant Kevin M Coffen in court with attorney Jeremy J Guza.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense requests matter be set for trial.
Court will set 21CM1919 for jury trial and have 22CM380 tag along for scheduling.
Jury trial expected to last 2 days.  Court will select an alternate juror.  Clerk to prepare trial order.
  Hearing scheduled for July 26, 2022 at 10:00 am.  Hearing scheduled for August 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no violent contact with victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.   Defendant is not to enter any premises, other than a grocery store, that sells/serves alcohol beverages by the drink or into any liquor store.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.    Defendant ordered to CAM monitoring through Wisconsin Community Services and the duration is pursuant to Pretrial Supervision Program protocols. Defendant to pay costs associated with CAM.  Defendant allowed one trip to the residence accompanied by a peace/police officer to obtain personal items.

10:16 AM Defendant Kevin M Coffen in court with attorney Jeremy J Guza.  Chelsea Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Victim A appeared by Zoom (video).
Court addresses motion to modify bond in 22CM380.
Arguments by the Defense.  State takes no position regarding contact.  Statement by Victim A.  Statement by defendant.
For the reasons stated on the record the Court grants the motion and orders the conditions of bond modified to no violent contact.
Hearing set for 6/8/22 to remain on the court's calendar as previously scheduled.
Bail/bond hearing on April 21, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Defendant's Motion to modify Bond
Hearing on June 8, 2022 at 10:30 am.

11:11 AM Defendant Kevin M Coffen in court with attorney Jeremy J Guza.  Melissa J. Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Court addresses motion to modify bond in 22CM380.
Arguments by the Defense.  Arguments by the State. 
For the reasons stated on the record the Court denies the motion to modify bond at this time.  Hearing scheduled for June 8, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Amended Order appointing counsel signed by Judge Michael O. Bohren on April 7, 2022. (BC)
Motion to Modify Bail
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.

10:11 AM Defendant Kevin M Coffen in court with attorney Jeremy J Guza.  Peter Michael Tempelis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Guza has been retained in 21CM1919 only.  The defendant has submitted a petition for appointment of counsel in the 22CM380 matter.
Attorney Guza is willing to take the appointment in 22CM380. Court grants petition for appointment of counsel and appoints Attorney Guza.  Defendant to pay $150.00 per month commencing 4/15/22.
Defense requests a bail/bond hearing in 22CM380.
  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for April 11, 2022 at 09:30 am.
